questions.question: Q1. Which of the following is a limitation of amperometry?

answers.d: Susceptibility to interference from other substances.

questions.question: Q2. Amperometry is particularly useful for studying _____________ reactions?
Q3. Why is electrodeposition commonly used in amperometry?

answers.a: To deposit a substance for analysis.

questions.question: Q4. Which characteristic of tungsten trioxide (WO3) semiconductor renders it suitable for application as an anode electrode in oxidation reactions?

answers.b: High thermal conductivity and low electrical resistance.
answers.c: Superior chemical stability and electrical conductivity.

questions.question: Q5. What is illustrated by the current-time graph in amperometry?

answers.a: The applied potential throughout the experiment.
answers.b: The resistance changes in the experimental setup.
answers.c: The variations in temperature and pressure during the electrochemical reaction.
answers.d: The flow of current concerning time during the experiment.

questions.question: Q6. Which types of electrodes are commonly used in amperometry?
Q7. How does the deposition time impact the resulting current-time graph in amperometry?

answers.a: Deposition time has no significant effect on the current-time graph.
answers.b: Longer deposition times lead to lower currents, suggesting decreased electrodeposition rates and thinner deposited layers.
answers.c: Longer deposition times generally lead to higher currents.
answers.d: Shorter deposition times result in higher currents due to rapid electrodeposition and enhanced material quality.

questions.question: Q8. Why is the amperometric method considered best for WO3 thin film fabrication compared to other electrodeposition methods?

answers.a: It ensures rapid growth of WO3 films, reducing fabrication time without compromising film quality.
answers.b: WO3 thin films prepared by amperometry exhibit unique optical properties.
answers.c: It allows precise control of the deposition process, leading to uniform and well-defined WO3 thin films.
answers.d: Other methods cannot measure current during deposition, resulting in poor quality and inconsistent WO3 films.
